intro: Erigeron rubicundus, commonly known as the redstem fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky areas. It features slender stems and small, pale yellow to reddish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron rubicundus is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
